meanings.definition: Surrounded or closed off on all sides.
meanings.sent1: The inclosed garden was a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent2: The house had an inclosed porch for relaxing.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt safe in the inclosed space under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The inclosed courtyard felt like a hidden oasis.
meanings.sent5: The inclosed area was so quiet, you could hear a pin drop.

meanings.definition: To insert something in an envelope or package.
meanings.sent1: Please inclosed the letter in the envelope before sending it.
meanings.sent2: She inclosed a gift card with the present.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally inclosed his keys in the package he mailed.
meanings.sent4: The surprise was inclosed in the small box.
meanings.sent5: Remember to inclosed the receipt in the return package.

meanings.sent1: The chef decided to inclosed extra spices in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The report inclosed detailed graphs for better understanding.
meanings.sent3: She always inclosed a personal note with her gifts.
meanings.sent4: His speech inclosed a powerful message of unity.
meanings.sent5: The contract inclosed additional terms for clarification.
